user.speaker: user
user.text: how to create schema or tables?

agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: Here are the steps to create a schema and tables: To create a schema: 1. Go to Databases. 2. Select the database in which you want to create a schema. 3. Click Create schema. 4. Type a name for the schema. 5. Specify the retention time interval (in days) for the schema. 6. Click Create. To create a table: 1. Log in to IBM® watsonx.data console. 2. From the navigation menu, select Data manager. 3. Select the engine from the Engine menu. Catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are listed. 4. Click Create and select Create table. 5. In the Create table form, drag a file to the box or click to upload. 6. Click the data type and choose the required data types for each column. Click Next. 7. In the Target form, select the Engine, Catalog, and Schema in which the table is created. 8. Enter a name for the table in the Table name field and click Next. 9. Verify the details in the Summary page and scroll down to view the DDL preview. 10. Click Create. 11. Verify that the table creation status in the Result set is successful, indicated as true. 12. Go to the Data manager page and select the schema under which you created the table and click the refresh icon. The newly created table is listed.

contexts.text:
Creating schema 

You can create schema from the Data manager page by using the web console.



1.  Log in to IBM® watsonx.data console.
2.  Select Data manager from the navigation menu.
3.  Select the engine from the Engine menu. The catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are displayed.
4.  Click the Create drop-down and select Create schema.



1.  In the Create schema form, select the catalog and enter schema name.
2.  Click Create. The schema is created under the selected catalog.

Schemas 



  Creating schemas 



1.  Go to Databases.
2.  Select the database in which you want to create a schema.
3.  Click Create schema.
4.  Type a name for the schema.
If the name contains special characters, enclose it in double quotation marks. The dot character (".") is not supported.
5.  Specify the retention time interval (in days) for the schema.
6.  Click Create.







  Updating retention time interval (time travel) for schemas 



1.  Go to Databases.
2.  Select the database in which the schema that you want to alter is.
3.  From the overflow menu, click Update interval.
4.  Type a retention time interval.
You can select between 1 day and up to 99 days, or zero to alter a temporal schema to nontemporal.
For more information on retention time interval and time travel, see [Netezza Performance Server time travel](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/netezza?topic=netezza-enablingdisabling_tt).
5.  Click Save.

Creating table 

You can generate, configure, and run DDL from the Data manager page by using the web console.



1.  Log in to IBM® watsonx.data console.
2.  From the navigation menu, select Data manager.
3.  Select the engine from the Engine menu. Catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are listed.
4.  Click Create and select Create table.
5.  In the Create table form, drag a file to the box or click to upload.

.CSV, .Parquet, .json, .txt are the supported data file formats. For .json file, you must enclose the content in [].
6.  Click the data type and choose the required data types for each column. Click Next.
7.  In the Target form, select the Engine, Catalog, and Schema in which the table is created.
8.  Enter a name for the table in the Table name field and click Next.
9.  Verify the details in the Summary page and scroll down to view the DDL preview.
10. Click Create.
11. Verify that the table creation status in the Result set is successful, indicated as true.
12. Go to the Data manager page and select the schema under which you created the table and click the refresh icon. The newly created table is listed.

agent.original_text:
Based on the documents provided, here are the steps to create a schema and tables:
To create a schema:
1. Go to Databases.
2. Select the database in which you want to create a schema.
3. Click Create schema.
4. Type a name for the schema.
5. Specify the retention time interval (in days) for the schema.
6. Click Create.
To create a table:
1. Log in to IBM® watsonx.data console.
2. From the navigation menu, select Data manager.
3. Select the engine from the Engine menu. Catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are listed.
4. Click Create and select Create table.
5. In the Create table form, drag a file to the box or click to upload.
6. Click the data type and choose the required data types for each column. Click Next.
7. In the Target form, select the Engine, Catalog, and Schema in which the table is created.
8. Enter a name for the table in the Table name field and click Next.
9. Verify the details in the Summary page and scroll down to view the DDL preview.
10. Click Create.
11. Verify that the table creation status in the Result set is successful, indicated as true.
12. Go to the Data manager page and select the schema under which you created the table and click the refresh icon. The newly created table is listed.
